meta.title: Operation of Biosafety Cabinet Class I

sections.purpose: To provide personnel and environmental protection when handling low to moderate-risk microorganisms.
sections.scope: Applicable to safe laboratory practices in Microbiology.
procedure: Switch ON the cabinet blower and fluorescent light.
Allow the air to purge for at least 15 minutes before use.
Check the pressure gauge to ensure airflow is within limits.
Disinfect the work surface with 70% ethanol.
Arrange necessary materials at least 6 inches from the front opening.
Perform work at the center of the work surface.
Avoid rapid arm movements to maintain airflow patterns.
After work, disinfect all items before removing them.
Wipe down the interior walls and surface with disinfectant.
Allow the blower to run for 5 minutes before switching OFF.
precautions: Do not use Bunsen burners inside the cabinet as they disrupt airflow.
Do not block the front air intake or rear exhaust grilles.
Wear appropriate PPE including lab coat and gloves.
This cabinet does not provide product protection (samples may be contaminated).
Annual certification by a qualified technician is mandatory.
